intro: Synepilaena, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to various regions of Australia, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Synepilaena species are known for their ability to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in horticulture.
